description: Let n+1 have proper divisors 1 < d_1,...,d_k < n+1; consider all proper divisors of n+d_1,...,n+d_k which did not appear earlier. Let them be d_{1,1}, d_{1,2},..., d_{k,1}, d_{k,2},..., d_{k,t}; then consider proper divisors of n+d_{1,1},...,n+d_{k,t} which did not appear earlier, repeat until no new divisor is introduced. a(n) is the total number of different divisors obtained.
